citation.article-title: Serinibacter salmoneus gen. nov., sp. nov., an actinobacterium isolated from the intestinal tract of a fish, and emended descriptions of the families Beutenbergiaceae and Bogoriellaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the family Beutenbergiaceae Zhi et al. 2009
The pattern of 16S rRNA gene sequence signatures consists of nucleotides at positions 144:178 (C–G), 280 (U), 293:304 (G–U), 668:738 (A–U), 1003:1038 (G–U), 1027:1034 (U–A) and 1414:1486 (U–A).
The family contains the type genus Beutenbergia (Groth et al., 1999) as well as the genera Salana (von Wintzingerode et al., 2001) and Serinibacter.
